Location: Tawang town, Tawang district, Arunachal Pradesh
Nearest Railway Station: Bhalukpong / Rangapara North / Tezpur (Assam) — approx. 270–330 km
Accessibility: Mountain roads; not wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Local guides available
Nearby Amenities: Hotels, guesthouses, restaurants, souvenir shops in Tawang town
Special Notes: One of the largest Tibetan Buddhist monasteries in India; major seat of Mahayana Buddhism

Location: On the Tezpur–Tawang highway (NH 13), between Tawang and Bomdila, Arunachal Pradesh
Timings: Accessible in daytime; often blocked in winter
Entry Fee: Not documented (ILP required for Arunachal entry)
Accessibility: High-altitude pass (13,700 ft); steep, winding roads
Guided Tours: Local drivers/guides from Tawang and Bomdila
Nearby Amenities: Minimal facilities; better hotels and restaurants in Tawang & Bomdila
Special Notes: Sacred to Buddhists; famous turquoise Sela Lake; strategic military post nearby

Name of Place: Nuranang Falls (Jang Falls / Bong Bong Falls)
Location: Near Jang town, ~40 km from Tawang, Tawang District, Arunachal Pradesh
Accessibility: Motoring road up to viewing area; short walk to base
Guided Tours: Local guides sometimes available
Nearby Amenities: Small shops and tea stalls in Jang; hotels & restaurants in Tawang
Special Notes: Filming location of Bollywood song “Tanhai Tanhai” (Koyla); pristine, less crowded waterfall

Location: Bomdila town, West Kameng District, Arunachal Pradesh
Accessibility: Hill town; road access from Tezpur/Guwahati
Guided Tours: Local guides available in Bomdila
Nearby Amenities: Hotels, homestays, cafes, and shops in Bomdila town
Special Notes: Known as “Gentse Gaden Rabgyel Lling” monastery; center for Lamaistic studies

Location: Dirang town, West Kameng District, Arunachal Pradesh
Accessibility: Good mountain road; motorable throughout
Guided Tours: Local homestays often arrange guides
Nearby Amenities: Resorts, homestays, local eateries, hot springs, shops
Special Notes: Famous for hot water springs, apple orchards, kiwi farms

Location: Ziro town, Lower Subansiri District, Arunachal Pradesh
Nearest Airport: Lilabari Airport (Assam) ~130 km / Donyi Polo Airport ~120 km
Accessibility: Roads motorable but winding
Guided Tours: Available — local Apatani guides, cultural village walks
Nearby Amenities: Resorts, homestays, restaurants, cafes, music festival grounds, shops
Special Notes: UNESCO Tentative World Heritage Site; famous for Apatani tribal culture, paddy–fish farming

Location: Miao town region, Changlang District, Arunachal Pradesh
Type: National Park / Wildlife Sanctuary / Tiger Reserve
Accessibility: Forest entry by road; treks inside range from easy to difficult
Guided Tours: Mandatory entry with permits; forest guides & guards available
Nearby Amenities: Forest rest houses, basic lodges, small eateries at Miao town
Special Notes: Fourth-largest national park in India; only park with four big cats

Location: Hilltop in Itanagar city, Papum Pare District, Arunachal Pradesh
Accessibility: Within city; short climb uphill (stairs)
Guided Tours: Local city guides available
Nearby Amenities: Hotels, cafes, restaurants in Itanagar
Special Notes: Yellow-roofed Buddhist Gompa; panoramic city views

Location: On the banks of the Siang River, East Siang District, Arunachal Pradesh
Nearest Airport: Pasighat Airport (domestic) ~5 km; Dibrugarh (major airport) ~150 km
Accessibility: Well connected by road from Dibrugarh and Itanagar
Guided Tours: Local guides for rafting, angling, village tours available
Nearby Amenities: Hotels, eco-resorts, markets, restaurants, river camps
Special Notes: Known as the “Gateway to Arunachal”; rafting hotspot

Location: Remote high-altitude valley, Shi-Yomi District, Arunachal Pradesh
Entry Fee: Not applicable (ILP required for Arunachal entry)
Accessibility: Remote mountain roads; difficult but scenic drive
Guided Tours: Local homestays & tourism dept. provide guides
Nearby Amenities: Homestays, guesthouses, small eateries; limited shops
Special Notes: Known for ancient Samten Yongcha Monastery, wooden hanging bridges

Location: At the foothills of the Mishmi Hills, Lower Dibang Valley, Arunachal Pradesh
Accessibility: Good road via Assam
Guided Tours: Local guides available for Mayodia Pass treks & tribal villages
Nearby Amenities: Hotels, lodges, homestays, small restaurants
Special Notes: Gateway to Mayodia Pass, Mehao Wildlife Sanctuary

Location: On the banks of the Subansiri River, Arunachal Pradesh
Type: River Valley Town / Tribal Culture Destination
Accessibility: Mountain roads; long winding routes
Guided Tours: Available — local guides for trekking, tribal village tours
Nearby Amenities: Basic hotels, shops, local eateries
Special Notes: Known for bamboo suspension bridges, tribal culture of Tagin & Hill Miri tribes

Location: 15 km from Dirang town, West Kameng District, Arunachal Pradesh
Accessibility: Road from Dirang; motorable
Guided Tours: Local birdwatching and trekking guides available
Nearby Amenities: Homestays, eco-resorts, local restaurants
Special Notes: Famous for black-necked cranes (migratory birds), apple & kiwi orchards

Location: On the Brahmaputra (Lohit River) banks, Lohit District, Arunachal Pradesh
Timings: Open all year; peak during Makar Sankranti (Jan)
Accessibility: Road motorable up to kund; steps down to river
Guided Tours: Pilgrimage organizers & local guides available
Nearby Amenities: Guesthouses in Tezu, small stalls near kund
Special Notes: Sacred Hindu pilgrimage; lakhs of devotees take a holy dip every January

Name of Place: Pangsau Pass & Lake of No Return
Location: Indo–Myanmar border, near Nampong town, Changlang District, Arunachal Pradesh
Entry Fee: Free (ILP required; special permits for border fair)
Accessibility: Hill roads from Nampong; motorable but steep and winding
Guided Tours: Available via tourism dept. during festival; local guides for WWII trail tours
Nearby Amenities: Homestays & small eateries at Nampong
Special Notes: Famous for WWII history (Stilwell Road); Lake of No Return associated with legends

Location: ~56 km from Roing town, Lower Dibang Valley District, Arunachal Pradesh
Type: Mountain Pass / Scenic Drive / Snow Destination
Timings: Open all day (seasonal closures in heavy snow)
Accessibility: Motorabale by road (NH13), winding roads with hairpin bends
Guided Tours: Local guides from Roing available for snow treks
Nearby Amenities: Rest houses in Roing; tea stalls on route
Special Notes: Famous for snow in winter; scenic views of Dibang Valley

Location: At the confluence of Siyom and Sipu rivers, West Siang District, Arunachal Pradesh
Accessibility: Connected by road from Pasighat & Likabali
Guided Tours: Available — local guides for tribal village tours
Nearby Amenities: Hotels, homestays, markets, eateries
Special Notes: Known for hanging bridges made of bamboo and cane

Location: Dambuk town, Lower Dibang Valley District, Arunachal Pradesh
Accessibility: Motorabale roads; last stretch slightly rough
Guided Tours: Festival packages & local guides available
Nearby Amenities: Festival camps, homestays, food stalls, adventure activity zones
Special Notes: Combines adventure sports with indie/rock music; promotes local oranges & tribal culture

Location: Chongkham town, Namsai District, Arunachal Pradesh
Accessibility: Easily accessible by road; temple complex wheelchair-friendly in many parts
Guided Tours: Available via local tourism offices
Nearby Amenities: Hotels in Namsai, restaurants, meditation centers
Special Notes: A Burmese-style temple built in 2010; important Theravada Buddhist pilgrimage

Location: ~30 km from Ziro town, Lower Subansiri District, Arunachal Pradesh
Accessibility: Trekking trails only
Guided Tours: Compulsory with forest guides; trekking packages available
Nearby Amenities: Homestays in Ziro; basic forest huts on trek
Special Notes: Dense subtropical forests; endangered clouded leopards; UNESCO tentative heritage zone

Location: Near Roing town, Lower Dibang Valley District, Arunachal Pradesh
Accessibility: Motoring road up to fort site; moderate walking required
Guided Tours: Local guides available at site
Nearby Amenities: Lodges in Roing town, small shops near site
Special Notes: 8th-century fort of Chutia dynasty; one of the oldest archaeological sites in Arunachal

Location: Likabali town, Lower Siang District, Arunachal Pradesh
Accessibility: Easily motorable; steps at temple site
Guided Tours: Local temple guides available
Nearby Amenities: Hotels in Likabali; local eateries & shops
Special Notes: Archaeological site (8th–12th century); associated with Krishna–Rukmini legends

Location: Tipi town, ~5 km from Bhalukpong, West Kameng District, Arunachal Pradesh
Accessibility: Motoring road; wheelchair access limited inside greenhouses
Guided Tours: Available; staff provide orchid information
Nearby Amenities: Small shops nearby; hotels & eateries in Bhalukpong
Special Notes: Houses over 1000 species of orchids; major research & conservation center
